nl.esciencecenter.neon.math

Class Float4Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.neon.math.FloatMatrix
      • nl.esciencecenter.neon.math.Float4Matrix

  • public class Float4Matrix
extends FloatMatrix
    4x4 float matrix implementation
    Author:
    Maarten van Meersbergen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Float4Matrix()
      Creates a new identity matrix.
      Float4Matrix(float in)
      Creates a new matrix with all slots filled with the parameter.
      Float4Matrix(Float4Matrix n)
      Creates a new matrix by copying the matrix used as parameter.
      Float4Matrix(Float4Vector v0, Float4Vector v1, Float4Vector v2, Float4Vector v3)
      Creates a new matrix, using the vectors in order as filling.
      Float4Matrix(float m00, float m01, float m02, float m03, float m10, float m11, float m12, float m13, float m20, float m21, float m22, float m23, float m30, float m31, float m32, float m33)
      Creates a new matrix using the parameters row-wise as filling.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Float4Matrix add(Float4Matrix n)
      Adds this matrix to the given matrix, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Matrix add(Number n)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Matrix div(Number n)
      Divides the elements of this matrix with the given scalar, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Matrix mul(Float4Matrix n)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given matrix, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Vector mul(Float4Vector v)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given vector, returning a new vector.
      Float4Matrix mul(Number n)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Matrix sub(Float4Matrix n)
      Substracts this matrix with the given matrix, returning a new matrix.
      Float4Matrix sub(Number n)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar, returning a new matrix.

        public Float4Matrix()
        Creates a new identity matrix.

      • Float4Matrix

        public Float4Matrix(float in)
        Creates a new matrix with all slots filled with the parameter.
        Parameters:
        in - The value to be put in all matrix fields.

      • Float4Matrix

        public Float4Matrix(Float4Vector v0,
            Float4Vector v1,
            Float4Vector v2,
            Float4Vector v3)
        Creates a new matrix, using the vectors in order as filling.
        Parameters:
        v0 - The first row of the matrix.
        v1 - The second row of the matrix.
        v2 - The third row of the matrix.
        v3 - The fourth row of the matrix.

      • Float4Matrix

        public Float4Matrix(float m00,
            float m01,
            float m02,
            float m03,
            float m10,
            float m11,
            float m12,
            float m13,
            float m20,
            float m21,
            float m22,
            float m23,
            float m30,
            float m31,
            float m32,
            float m33)
        Creates a new matrix using the parameters row-wise as filling.
        Parameters:
        m00 - The parameter on position 0x0.
        m01 - The parameter on position 0x1.
        m02 - The parameter on position 0x2.
        m03 - The parameter on position 0x3.
        m10 - The parameter on position 1x0.
        m11 - The parameter on position 1x1.
        m12 - The parameter on position 1x2.
        m13 - The parameter on position 1x3.
        m20 - The parameter on position 2x0.
        m21 - The parameter on position 2x1.
        m22 - The parameter on position 2x2.
        m23 - The parameter on position 2x3.
        m30 - The parameter on position 3x0.
        m31 - The parameter on position 3x1.
        m32 - The parameter on position 3x2.
        m33 - The parameter on position 3x3.

      • Float4Matrix

        public Float4Matrix(Float4Matrix n)
        Creates a new matrix by copying the matrix used as parameter.
        Parameters:
        n - The old matrix to be copied.
